title: Capacitor - energy change when separating plates

content.question: A parallel-plate capacitor with plates of area <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi></math> and plate separation <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math> is attached to a battery and given a charge <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Q</mi></math>. The potential energy stored in the capacitor is <math alttext="U sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. The capacitor is then detached from the battery and then the plates are pulled apart to a distance <math alttext="2 d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>d</mi></math>. The potential energy stored in the capacitor is now <math alttext="U sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. Which of the following correctly describes the ratio of the potential energies <math alttext="the fraction U sub 1 over U sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle><msub><mi>U</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mfrac></mstyle></math>?

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
